main event: Several spherical objects, approximately 12-15 inches in diameter and white in color, were observed in Cochise, New Mexico on 22 February 1956 for approximately 5 minutes. They appeared to be baseball card sized and dimmed as they pulled away at high speed.
interesting points: The objects were observed by a military student pilot.
The spherical objects appeared to be about baseball card sized and dimmed as they moved away at high speed.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes.
The report concludes that further investigation was not directed by Headquarters.
The objects were observed in Cochise, New Mexico, in 1956.
sighted object: several spherical objects, approximately 12-15 inches in diameter and white in color
